title: An Octopus Followed Me Home
text:
An Octopus Followed Me Home is a 1997 <a href="United%20States">American</a> <a href="Children%27s%20literature">children's</a> <a href="picture%20book">picture book</a> by American writer and illustrator, <a href="Dan%20Yaccarino">Dan Yaccarino</a>. The book has been adapted by Yaccarino into an animated television series called, "<a href="Willa%27s%20Wild%20Life">Willa's Wild Life</a>". It is directed by Steve Sullivan.
Plot.
The book tells of a young girl who takes a <a href="green">green</a> <a href="octopus">octopus</a> home. When the girl asks her father if she can keep the octopus in the <a href="bathtub">tub</a>, he tells her about all the other animals he let her keep and all the sacrifices he made. The saddened girl returns the octopus back to the <a href="ocean">ocean</a>, but becomes happy again when a <a href="gray">gray</a> <a href="brachiosaurus">brachiosaurus</a> follows her home.
